title.narrative: Tanzania Country Programme. Good Governance and Human Rights

description.narrative: The Governance and Rights Programme 2016-21 will contribute to the promotion of democracy, good governance, rule of law and respect for human rights with a special focus on women. The theory of change for the programme is based on the assumption that democratic, transparent and accountable governance where women’s rights are equal to men’s provides the most fertile ground for economic development and eradication of poverty and inequality. Strengthening of demand-side governance will contribute to stronger institutional checks and balances, empower citizens, and enhance the potential impact of Danish support provided to Government. In the short-term, change is expected in terms of a stronger and more vocal civil society, increasingly demanding transparency and responsive governance from duty bearers, as well as an increased access to justice for women and men. A particular change is expected in terms of increased awareness of and respect for women’s rights.

title.narrative: Prevention of and response to Gender Based Violence promoted through the media campaign to influence behavior and strengthen legal frameworks and mechanisms for public and community action

Number of improved mechanism to respond to GBV such as paralegals and community GBV committees in program districts with capacity to plan, implement plans, strategizing and holding different actors accountable

target.value: 10 GBV committees document use of community radios to raise awareness

actual.value: 1,197 GBV stories were covered by different media houses, 192 regular stories which were written and published in different newspapers, 152 feature articles, 742 radio and television stories, 42 radio and TV programmes produced and 69 stories from social media.

target.value: 10 GBV committees operational 165 GBV committee members trained

actual.value: 10 GBV committees operational 165 GBV committee members trained

target.value: 10 GBV committees contribute towards case studies (10 from each district)
10 GBV committees document use of community radios to raise awareness

actual.value: A total of 182 GBV incidences/cases (81 in Pemba and 101 in Unguja) were identified and followed up by the networks. Currently, 51of them are at police stations for further investigation, 40 at DPP for update, office and 56 are proceeding in courts. In addition, 20 cases are at Gender desk and 15 at social welfare office

target.value: 10 GBV committees document use of community radios to raise awareness

actual.value: A total of 243 cases were identified and followed up by the GBV committee. Currently, 124 of them are at the police station, 70 at DPP and 49 are proceeding in courts

target.value: Sustain 11 GBV networks to document GBV issues and use of community radios to raise awareness

title.narrative: Increased Media Coverage on Gender Based Violence
Number of articles and cases produced by Youth Media Fellow per assigned project district

target.value: 10 Youth media fellows trained, at least 50 feature articles/case studies produced

actual.value: 11 Youth media fellows trained, at least 52 feature articles/case studies produced

target.value: 10 Youth media fellows each use media channels to share case studies and raise awareness, 100 feature articles/case studies publicised via traditional and non-traditional media

actual.value: 30 stories published by Youth media follows

target.value: 18 Youth media fellows in Zanzibar each use media channels to share case studies and raise awareness, 500 feature articles/case studies publicised via traditional and non-traditional media channels, events

5 Youth media fellows in Zanzibar each use media channels to share case studies and raise awareness, 100 feature articles/case studies publicised via traditional and non-traditional media channels, events

actual.value: YMF managed to produce a total of 213 stories, 131 from mainstream radio and television, 56 print and 26 social media that contributed to increased debate about the GBV/ VAC pandemic.

target.value: 5 Youth media fellows in Zanzibar each use media channels to share case studies and raise awareness, 100 feature articles/case studies publicised via traditional and non-traditional media channels, events

actual.value: YMF managed to produce a total of 447 stories, 124 from mainstream radio and television, 66 print and 231 social media (including Facebook and Twitter), 26 community radio programme that contributed to increased debate about the GBV/ VAC pandemic.

target.value: 5 Youth media fellows in Zanzibar each use media channels to share case studies and raise awareness, 100 feature articles/case studies publicised via traditional and non-traditional media channels, events

actual.value: Youth media fellows produced a total of 261 media stories including 33 feature articles, 28 radio programs and 200 stories which continue to stimulate public debate on the GBV.

title.narrative: Increased number of actions taken by community members, GBV committees, survivors, police gender desks, paralegals, media, youth media fellows and Members of Parliament to prevent and address GBV at community level. These can include effective campaigns, collective voice and successful operation of the GBV committees in the 10 project districts.
Number of successful advocacy actions taken at community level to prevent and address GBV.

target.value: Effective campaigns, collective voice and successful operation of the GBV networks and committees in the five project districts
